title: Chapter 2: Probability of Single & Independent Events
subject: Mathematics

questions.question: A fair six-sided die is rolled once. What is the probability of rolling a prime number?
questions.explanation: Prime numbers on a die: 2, 3, 5 (3 outcomes). Total = 6. P(prime) = 3/6 = 1/2.

questions.question: A bag contains 4 red, 3 blue, and 3 green marbles. One marble is drawn randomly. What is P(not red)?
questions.explanation: Total marbles = 10. Not red = 3 blue + 3 green = 6. P(not red) = 6/10 = 3/5.

questions.question: A fair coin is flipped three times. What is P(all three tails)?
questions.explanation: Independent events: P(TTT) = P(T) × P(T) × P(T) = (1/2)³ = 1/8.

questions.question: Two independent events have P(A) = 0.4 and P(B) = 0.6. What is P(A and B)?
questions.explanation: For independent events: P(A and B) = P(A) × P(B) = 0.4 × 0.6 = 0.24.

If P(X) = 0.5 and P(Y) = 0.4 with X,Y independent, what is P(X or Y)?
A box has 9 good and 1 defective item. Two items selected with replacement. P(both good)?
questions.explanation: With replacement: P(good) = 9/10 each time. P(both good) = 0.9 × 0.9 = 0.81.
